neighbors.name: Dye Elan Revocable Trust
neighbors.claims: Dye Elan Revocable Trust is a private living trust presumably used by a local landowner to hold farmland in Saline County; such revocable trusts are commonly used by farmers for managing and transferring land assets [Farmland Access Legal Toolkit](https://farmlandaccess.org/trusts/). The trust’s parcel is adjacent to a proposed 1,000-acre solar farm on county land, and the developer has been negotiating contracts with surrounding landowners in that area [Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/e74744c0-255e-453b-83b9-51557137da81).
neighbors.influence_justification: Individual farm owner; no known broader political or economic influence

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the trust’s landowner (trustee) directly with transparency; emphasize how the project can provide steady income while respecting the farm’s legacy. Be prepared to address concerns about farmland preservation and involve them in planning to build trust.

neighbors.name: Fulton Ruby A Trust
neighbors.claims: Fulton Ruby A Trust appears to be a personal trust for Ruby A. Fulton, holding family land with no corporate operations; like many farm trusts, it likely serves as an estate planning tool to manage and eventually transfer farmland assets [Farmland Access Legal Toolkit](https://farmlandaccess.org/trusts/). This trust’s property lies near the county-owned farmland slated for a large solar project, and the solar developer has interacted with nearby landowners about participation agreements [Salina Post](https://salinapost.com/posts/e74744c0-255e-453b-83b9-51557137da81).
neighbors.influence_justification: Small-scale landholder; minimal public profile or community sway beyond immediate neighbors

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach the trust’s representative (family landowner) personally and respectfully; underscore the mutual benefits of the project, such as supplemental income, while assuring that agricultural use and land value will be protected. Address any concerns about losing farmland productivity to gain their support.
